intro: Ceropegia mannarana, commonly known as the Manarana milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, pale greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
